intro: Icica dentata, commonly known as the toothed icica, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Iciceae and is characterized by its distinctive serrated leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are often covered in a fine, white powder, which helps to reduce water loss in its harsh habitat. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, Icica dentata is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
